title: WATCH | These crazy guys rebuild a 1957 tractor with a Toyota 2JZ engine
text:
The Toyota 2JZ-GTE is one of the most popular engines throughout the world, known for its impressive power and tuning potential.

Guys from the Youtube channel Life OD, decided to do something totally out of the norm by dropping the straight-6 engine into a 1957 Ferguson tractor.

Plenty of elbow and grease

This is by no means a straight fit, requiring plenty of mechanical and structural alterations to make sure the engine sits where the old carburetor one used to.

READ | One mean mower: Honda wants to break speed record by doing 240km/h in a lawnmower

A tractor was never made to go fast but one can't help but think how it will perform and operate with an engine that came out of the factory with more than 200kW. We will have to wait and see what happens next.

Watch the video:
description: The Toyota 2JZ-GTE is one of the most popular engines throughout the world, known for its impressive power and tuning potential. Watch how these guys fit it into a tractor.
